lee-goldwasser-2022-towards.title: Towards Explaining Subjective Ground of Individuals on Social Media
lee-goldwasser-2022-towards.author:
Lee, Younghun  and
Goldwasser, Dan
lee-goldwasser-2022-towards.paperMotivationText: Large-scale language models have been reducing the gap between machines and humans in understanding the real world, yet understanding an individual’s theory of mind and behavior from text is far from being resolved.
lee-goldwasser-2022-towards.paperContributionText: This research proposes a neural model— Subjective Ground Attention—that learns subjective grounds of individuals and accounts for their judgments on situations of others posted on social media.
lee-goldwasser-2022-towards.paperResultsText: They empirically show that their model provides human-readable explanations of an individual’s subjective preference in judging social situations. The evaluation shows their model learns an individual’s subjective orientation towards abstract moral concepts.
